name: How to enter combat without causing an Attack of Opportunity
author: webshaman1

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Does anyone know how to enter combat with an opponent without causing an AoO with NWN:EE with the current patch?

Not only do I find this to be extremely difficult atm, but also, I notice that the first attack(s) seem to have bonuses to hit!

This is frustrating.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Walk instead of running?  Wait for them to approach you, drawing AoO from you?   I'm just brainstorming ideas, not spouting facts.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content: Here's a pic of what I mean :

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
If you examine the above, you will see a few things :

The roll for initiative (of which I have a 30).

These Bugbears do not have a Dex bonus, so they add nothing to Initiative.  Even with a nat 20, they can't beat my 30, so why are their flurries going before mine??

In this case, the PC has a high enough tumble to avoid the AoO from entering combat, but it still does not explain how this whole combat thing works.  The bugbears were not in combat before I attacked them (that I am aware of).

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I haven't studied your screenshot in detail, Web, but the whole issue reminds me of an old bug (at least in vanilla NWN) where NPCs were always able to have a first attack, even if you won the initiative check and darted off immediately before they should be able to react, EG if playing with a stalker HIPS assassin.
I found that using RANGED attacks solved it.

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
I don't believe that these are actually Attacks of Opportunity. I think the engine would identify them as such in the combat log. I've had a problem with initiative for a long time, it's never worked without an issue for me. I think this is just some hidden mechanic, perhaps related to weapon reach, that is hard to mitigate. I remember being perturbed about this on a permadeath modern zombie survival server.

I'd suggest maybe trying with a longer weapon and seeing if that helps the issue. I'd check myself but I'm not actively playing now, trying to finish Elden Ring before the DLC drops.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I've tried every weapon type on WoG (which is all I have access to for testing) and the opponents of medium or bigger always go first. From Greatsword, to Halberd, to TH Spear, nothing has longer reach than a critwall buggy with either a Greataxe or a Katana, apparently.  Luckily, the Greataxe users will suck down a potion of barkskin, often giving you the advantage, but if they notice your "aggro" beforehand, they will drink the potion as you are out of range.  I've done Greataxe vs Greataxe, Katana vs Katana, and everything else inbetween, but nothing actually makes any difference.

I do think it is a matter of reach - the "reach" of the opponents is just longer (unless they are small vs our medium).  The AI reacts quicker, of course, and you can see this when they rush you, stop right outside of your reach, and attack...which goes first.

The AoO is when you go into combat against them (meaning you move to engage after you have clicked the weapon pointer on them, activating attack).  Unless you have a way to mitigate it, such will cause AoO.  Walking into combat will keep this from happening, but then, they will attack you first, again.

Anyway, I just want to thank everyone for their replies, insights, and posts.  I guess this is just a NWN Engine thing that is inherent to it.  I just wish I coild find a way around it.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
When attacking a non player creature from stealth with a dexterity based character with an inherently high initiative, killing the NPC in the first flurry - and still getting hit. 
It can't be about initiative, and it can hardly be about reach when you already are within striking distance with your own weapons when you break stealth and attack.
It looks like a bug to me.
(And it wouldn't surprise me if you got hit, even when attacking a stunned or otherwise incapacitated NPC.) (But I can't remember if I tested that.)
